functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"

msg.content: Could you help me create a travel plan for 3 days that starts from Houston to Wichita from March 19th to March 21st, 2022? We're a group of 3 people with a budget of $2,700. Smoking is a necessity for us, so accommodating this into our hotel arrangements would be beneficial.

Could you help me create a travel plan for 3 days that starts from Houston to Wichita from March 19th to March 21st, 2022? We're a group of 3 people with a budget of $2,700. Smoking is a necessity for us, so accommodating this into our hotel arrangements would be beneficial.

functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: accommodation_search
functions.desc:
Discover accommodations in your desired city.
Example: accommodation_search("Rome") would present a list of hotel rooms in Rome.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking accommodation.

functions.name: attraction_search
functions.desc:
Find attractions in a city of your choice.
Example: attraction_search("London") would return attractions in London.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking attractions.

functions.name: city_search
functions.desc:
Find cities in a state of your choice.
Example: city_search("California") would return cities in California.

state.description: The name of the state where you're seeking cities.

functions.name: flight_search
functions.desc:
A flight information retrieval tool.
Example: flight_search("New York", "London", "2022-10-01") would fetch flights from New York to London on October 1, 2022.

departure_city.description: The city you'll be flying out from.

destination_city.description: The city you aim to reach.

date.description: The date of your travel in YYYY-MM-DD format.

functions.name: google_distance_matrix
functions.desc:
Estimate the distance, time and cost between two cities.
Example: google_distance_matrix("Paris", "Lyon", "self-driving") would provide driving distance, time and cost between Paris and Lyon.

origin.description: The departure city of your journey.

destination.description: The destination city of your journey.

functions.name: restaurant_search
functions.desc:
Explore dining options in a city of your choice.
Example: restaurant_search("Tokyo") would show a curated list of restaurants in Tokyo.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking restaurants.

msg.content: Search for flights from Houston to Wichita on March 19th, 2022 for 2 adults and 1 child.

Example: attraction_search("London") would return attractions in London.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking attractions.

functions.name: city_search
functions.desc:
Find cities in a state of your choice.
Example: city_search("California") would return cities in California.

state.description: The name of the state where you're seeking cities.

functions.name: flight_search
functions.desc:
A flight information retrieval tool.
Example: flight_search("New York", "London", "2022-10-01") would fetch flights from New York to London on October 1, 2022.

departure_city.description: The city you'll be flying out from.

destination_city.description: The city you aim to reach.

date.description: The date of your travel in YYYY-MM-DD format.

functions.name: google_distance_matrix
functions.desc:
Estimate the distance, time and cost between two cities.
Example: google_distance_matrix("Paris", "Lyon", "self-driving") would provide driving distance, time and cost between Paris and Lyon.

origin.description: The departure city of your journey.

destination.description: The destination city of your journey.

functions.name: restaurant_search
functions.desc:
Explore dining options in a city of your choice.
Example: restaurant_search("Tokyo") would show a curated list of restaurants in Tokyo.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking restaurants.

Here's a three-day itinerary for Wichita, Kansas, packed with fun attractions to enjoy:

**Day 1:**
- Start your day at the Sedgwick County Zoo, where you can explore a variety of animal exhibits and enjoy interactive encounters.
- In the afternoon, head over to the Museum of World Treasures, which showcases a diverse collection of artifacts and treasures from around the globe.
- End your day at the Old Cowtown Museum, an outdoor living history museum that brings the Old West to life.

**Day 2:**
- Visit the Wichita Art Museum, which features a beautiful collection of art, including sculptures, paintings, and photography.
- After that, check out the Great Plains Nature Center, a great place to learn about the natural history and wildlife of the region.
- In the evening, attend a show or exhibition at Exploration Place, a hands-on science museum with a range of interactive exhibits.

**Day 3:**
- Begin your day at the Kansas Aviation Museum, which is perfect for aviation enthusiasts with its collection of historic aircraft and exhibits.
- Next, stop by The Keeper of the Plains, a unique monument and sculpture that is an iconic symbol of Wichita.
- Spend the afternoon exploring the Wichita-Sedgwick County Historical Museum to learn about the city's rich history.
- Before you leave Wichita, make sure to visit Botanica, The Wichita Gardens, a stunning botanical garden with a variety of floral displays and water features.

Certainly! Here are some restaurant recommendations for breakfast, lunch, and dinner in Wichita over three days: 

## Day 1:

**Breakfast**:
- Cafe Cornucopia - A cozy spot offering a variety of teas, coffees, and baked goods. Perfect for a relaxing morning meal.
**Lunch**:
- Chimney - The Takeaway - Enjoy a Mediterranean-inspired lunch with their pizza and seafood options. 
**Dinner**:
- Carbon Bistro - Indulge in some delicious seafood and Italian cuisine for a fine dining experience. 

## Day 2:

**Breakfast**:
- The B.A.W.A - Start your day with a hearty breakfast of tea and pizza! They also offer BBQ and Chinese dishes. 
**Lunch**:
- Urban Kabab - Try their Mexican and seafood dishes for a unique lunch experience. 
**Dinner**:
- Soul Curry - Bellagio - Sample some Italian and Mexican flavors, with a variety of desserts to satisfy your sweet tooth. 

## Day 3:

**Breakfast**:
- Cafe Red - A great choice for breakfast with a range of options, including Mexican and BBQ. 
**Lunch**:
- Jawahpanah - A highly rated Indian restaurant with a fast-food twist, serving desserts too. 
**Dinner**:
- The Flying Saucer Cafe - A popular choice for a dinner of pizza, BBQ, and tea. 

Please note that the average costs provided are an estimate and may vary. These recommendations offer a mix of cuisines and dining experiences to explore during your stay in Wichita.

Unfortunately, I couldn't find any hotels in Wichita that are smoking-friendly. However, I can provide you with some information on attractions and non-smoking-friendly accommodations in Wichita.

## Attractions in Wichita:
- Old Cowtown Museum: This museum offers a glimpse into the history of Wichita's early days as a cattle town.
- Exploration Place: An interactive science and cultural center with hands-on exhibits and an immersive experience.
- Museum of World Treasures: Showcasing a diverse collection of artifacts and exhibits from around the world.
- The Keeper of the Plains: A iconic landmark and sculpture with a rich cultural significance for the Wichita community.
- Wichita Art Museum: Featuring an impressive collection of American art, including paintings, sculptures, and ceramics.
- Kansas Aviation Museum: Delve into the rich aviation history of Kansas with exhibits and artifacts.
- Sedgwick County Zoo: Home to over 3,000 animals from various continents, offering an educational and entertaining experience.
- Great Plains Nature Center: Providing an opportunity to explore the natural beauty and wildlife of the Great Plains.
- Wichita-Sedgwick County Historical Museum: Showcasing the history and heritage of the Wichita area.
- Botanica, The Wichita Gardens: A beautiful botanical garden with a variety of plants and seasonal displays.
- Frank Lloyd Wright's Allen House: Tour the iconic architect's only prairie-style house in Kansas.
- Great Plains Transportation Museum: Featuring a collection of vintage vehicles and transportation-related artifacts.
- Mid-America All-Indian Museum: Highlighting the culture and history of Native Americans.
- Ulrich Museum of Art: Located on Wichita State University's campus, it showcases modern and contemporary art.
- The Kansas African American Museum: Focusing on African American culture and history.
- All Star Adventures: An entertainment center with go-kart racing, mini-golf, and more.
- Kansas Firefighters Museum: Celebrating the history and contributions of firefighters.
- Wichita Toy Train Club & Museum: A unique museum dedicated to toy trains and model railroading.
- Veterans Memorial Park: A peaceful park honoring military veterans.
- Steampunk Village: A unique and quirky attraction with steampunk-themed shops and experiences.

## Accommodations in Wichita:
- LL2: A private room for $61 per night, with house rules including no smoking, no pets, and no parties.
- Clean and bright with a comfortable atmosphere: A private room for $546 per night, no pets and no parties allowed.
- Stunning duplex in Fort Greene: An entire home/apt for $160 per night, no smoking or pets allowed.
- Secret Garden Apartment in Bed Stuy, Brooklyn: An entire home/apt for $214 per night, no smoking, and no children under 10.
